text: Alright, update on the soccer stickers with black backgrounds. The artist definitely did not intend for this. There are two stickers with a goalie net drawn in black that completely disappears when put on a black background. The other 4 don't lose important details but in my opinion look pretty lame with all the white matting/outlining around characters. I would strongly recommend against changing it from the white background that we already have it on. If Dave B. still wants this, we should request that their artist redraws/edits these files as I'm not comfortable trying to make this many changes for them.
<@U030TQFR3>, <@U0265G76F>, how should I approach stickers knowing this? Should I make a gif in black to show as an example to Immersion or just tell them we advise against it?
oof - yeah that sounds like a mess, but think i understand the situation
Let's make a couple examples of the bad look. Then we'll draft up a note with our recommended direction (keep on white) and attach the examples.
i guess my thought would be to go back with something like — We can change what we can, but some (see soccer example) might require artist to redo

With the time we have left (less than a week), I'd rather suggest we keep things on white. If that's not acceptable to them, then we'll open it up to their artists editing and redelivering for a black background.
i'm fully in support of this thought
Great. So Ben does that mean you still want me to cook up a quick reference gif with a black BG to show what we're talking about? Won't take me long.
Yes, please. Let's do two reference GIFs -- one with the black net that disappears, and one of the others with all the white matting/outlining.
Ok cool. I'll set that up now then. Tanks
Ben, would you like to tactfully craft the note to Immersion on this one?
